intro: Sida macrodon, commonly known as the largeleaf sida, is a herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in loose inflorescences, typically blooming in summer. Sida macrodon is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats including roadsides and open woodlands.
